SENT.plain: BMI1 is a key component of multiprotein Polycomb repression complex 1 (PRC1), and its disruption in mice induces severe aplastic anemia by early adulthood
The contributing mechanisms responsible for this phenotype remain elusive

Here we show that transformed human cell lines as well as primitive hematopoietic cells exhibit a high frequency of spontaneous chromosome breaks upon BMI1 depletion and are hypersensitive to genotoxic agents
Consistent with these observations, we found that BMI1 is recruited rapidly to DNA damage foci where it blocks transcriptional elongation
We also show that BMI1 contributes to homologous recombination DNA repair and is required for checkpoint recovery
Taken together, our results suggest that BMI1 is critical for the maintenance of chromosome integrity in both normal and transformed cells
